Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with proton conducting electrolyte (H-SOFCs) are promising power sources for stationary applications.
Titulo: Modeling of Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Fueled with Syngas

Sentencas: Compared with other types of fuel cells, one distinct feature of SOFC is their fuel flexibility.
Titulo: Modeling of Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Fueled with Syngas

Sentencas: In this study, a 2D model is developed to investigate the transport and reaction in an H-SOFC fueled with syngas, which can be produced from conventional natural gas or renewable biomass.
Titulo: Modeling of Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Fueled with Syngas

Sentencas: The model fully considers the fluid flow, mass transfer, heat transfer and reactions in the H-SOFC.
Titulo: Modeling of Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Fueled with Syngas

Sentencas: Parametric studies are conducted to examine the physical and chemical processes in H-SOFC with a focus on how the operating parameters affect the H-SOFC performance.
Titulo: Modeling of Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Fueled with Syngas

Sentencas: It is found that the presence of CO dilutes the concentration of H-2, thus decreasing the H-SOFC performance.
Titulo: Modeling of Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Fueled with Syngas

Sentencas: With typical syngas fuel, adding H2O cannot enhance the performance of the H-SOFC, although water gas shift reaction can facilitate H-2 production.
Titulo: Modeling of Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Fueled with Syngas
